intro: Bunochilus loganii, commonly known as the Logan's bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
